The Act titled "Natural Resource Management on Military Lands Act of 1994" amends the Sikes Act to promote wildlife conservation on military reservations. Integrated natural resource management plans are required for military installations. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations, with exceptions if the Secretary deems it inappropriate. Conforming amendments further specify the requirement for these plans. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations, with exceptions if the Secretary deems it inappropriate. Conforming amendments specify the requirement for these plans by replacing "cooperative plan" with "integrated natural resource management plan" throughout the text. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations, replacing "cooperative plan" with "integrated natural resource management plan" throughout the text. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations, replacing "cooperative plans" with "integrated natural resource management plans" throughout the text. The contents of the plans include wetland protection and restoration, consideration of conservation needs for all biological communities, and the establishment of specific natural resource management goals, objectives, and time-frames for proposed actions. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations. The plans must address fish and wildlife management, land management, forest management, and wildlife-oriented recreation. They should ensure no net loss in the capability of installation lands to support the military mission, provide for sustained public use of natural resources, and maintain consistency among activities conducted under the plan. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations, addressing fish and wildlife management, land management, forest management, and wildlife-oriented recreation. The plans must ensure no net loss in the capability of installation lands to support the military mission, provide sustained public use of natural resources, maintain consistency among activities, and allow for public comment on each plan. SEC. 4. REVIEW OF MILITARY INSTALLATIONS FOR INTEGRATED NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANS. The Secretary of each military department must review all military installations in the United States to determine which ones require an integrated natural resource management plan. A report on these determinations must be submitted to the Secretary of Defense, who will then report to Congress within 12 months. The Secretary of Defense must submit a report to Congress listing military installations where an integrated natural resource management plan is not deemed appropriate, along with explanations. Within 2 years of this report, plans must be prepared and implemented for installations where such a plan is deemed appropriate. The Secretary of Defense must submit a report to Congress listing military installations where an integrated natural resource management plan is not deemed appropriate. Plans must be prepared and implemented for installations where such a plan is deemed appropriate, with public comment opportunities provided. SEC. 5. ANNUAL REVIEWS AND REPORTS. Section 101 (16 U.S.C. 670a) is further amended by adding subsection (g) requiring the Secretary of Defense to review and report on the implementation of integrated natural resource management plans annually. The report must include the number of plans in effect, expenditures on conservation activities, and details on the Legacy Resource Management Program. The Secretary of Defense must annually review and report on integrated natural resource management plans, including the number of plans, expenditures on conservation activities, and details on the Legacy Resource Management Program. The Secretary of the Interior must also submit a report on expenditures by the Department of the Interior and State agencies for conservation or wildlife management. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report by March 1 in consultation with State agencies on the expenditures for conservation activities conducted under integrated natural resource management plans to the Committees on Merchant Marine and Fisheries and Armed Services of the House of Representatives, and the Committees on Armed Services and Environment and Public Works of the Senate. SEC. 6. FEDERAL ENFORCEMENT OF INTEGRATED NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANS; ENFORCEMENT OF OTHER LAWS.

Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is amended to allow the Secretary of Defense to enforce Federal laws related to conservation on military installations within the United States.

SEC. 7. NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT SERVICES.

Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is further amended to ensure each military department has trained personnel for natural resource management and law enforcement to comply with integrated natural resource management plans.

SEC. 8. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 8. DEFINITIONS. Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is further amended by inserting after section 107 the following: "SEC. 108. DEFINITIONS." SEC. 108. DEFINITIONS. Defines terms such as military department, military installation, state fish and wildlife agency, and United States. SEC. 9. SHORT TITLE. Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is further amended by inserting after section 108 the following: "SEC. 109. SHORT TITLE. This title may be cited as the 'Sikes Act'." SEC. 10. COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS. Amends cost-sharing basis in section 103a(b) and accounting in section 103a(c). SEC. 11. REPEAL. Repeals section 2 of the Act of October 27, 1986. SEC. 12. CLERICAL AMENDMENTS. Title I is amended to replace "military reservations" with "military installations" in various sections, including section 101 and section 102. In Title I, "military reservations" is replaced with "military installations" in different sections, including section 101, section 102, and section 103. SEC. 13. AUTHORIZATIONS OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends sections related to programs on military installations and public lands by updating the years for authorizations of appropriations to 1994, 1995, 1996, and 1997.
